oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reclaiming the Right to live from the Land: Developing local food sovereignty alliances to normalise peasant agriculture in the 21st century
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Anderson, Fergal
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Community development
Farm economics
Social aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Throughout history, peasant farming has proved remarkably resilient to the forces of free-market capitalism both in Europe and Internationally. However, in many countries there are declining numbers of small scale famers, and an increase in larger conventional farms (due to international and national policies). There is an urgent need to renormalise and celebrate the resilience and adaptability of the peasant farming model, and look at how it can be adapted into our 21st century societies.
